security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based Claude skill with two local utility scripts. Scripts access local filesystem only within project root with proper path traversal protection. No network calls, no credential access, no external command execution. Minimal security footprint with Python standard library only.

low_findings.title: Local filesystem access in utility scripts
low_findings.description: Both Python scripts access the local filesystem to create and write files within the project root. append_log.py creates `.ai_context/03_ACTIVE_TASK.md` and appends log entries. plan_helper.py writes plan templates to files. These operations include path traversal protection (lines 76-79 in plan_helper.py, lines 62-75 in append_log.py) and are scoped to the project directory as documented. This is necessary for the skill's purpose of maintaining project context.

content.user_title: Structure AI projects with memory and logs
content.value_statement: Managing AI-assisted projects becomes chaotic without structure. This skill adds external memory files and manifest dispatch so your AI assistant remembers context across sessions and follows clear workflows.
actual_capabilities: Creates and maintains .ai_context memory files in project root
Generates mini execution plans with goal, constraints, steps, and validation
Appends structured development logs with timestamps
Guides users through mini TDD workflow
limitations: Does not execute code or shell commands automatically
Does not access external APIs or network resources
Does not modify files outside the designated project root
Does not provide built-in code generation or refactoring

prompt_templates.title: Initialize project context
prompt_templates.prompt: I want to start a new project. Help me set up the AI Architect Lite context and create a mini plan for building a user authentication module.

prompt_templates.title: Log development progress
prompt_templates.prompt: I just finished implementing the login endpoint. Record this action in the development log with the changes I made and the outcome.

prompt_templates.title: Generate execution plan
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a mini plan for adding password reset functionality. Include constraints around email security and validation steps to verify the implementation.

prompt_templates.title: Check current task state
prompt_templates.prompt: Read the current active task context and give me a summary of what state the project is in and what the next steps should be.

output_examples.input: Help me set up AI Architect Lite for my new Python project
output: ‚úì Ready to track your active mission and development log
‚Ä¢ Suggested next steps: 1) Define your project goal, 2) Generate a mini plan, 3) Start tracking progress

best_practices: Run append_log.py after each significant action to build a complete history
Use plan_helper.py before starting work to define clear goals and validation steps
Keep the active task state updated as your project evolves through different stages
anti_patterns: Skipping the initial context setup leads to lost context between sessions
Modifying .ai_context files manually while scripts are running can cause conflicts
Ignoring validation steps defeats the purpose of the mini TDD workflow

faq.question: What tools are compatible with this skill?
faq.answer: Works with Claude, OpenAI Codex, and Claude Code. Provide command-line interface for script execution.

faq.question: What are the file size and project limits?
faq.answer: No hard limits. Works with projects of any size. Context files scale with project complexity.

faq.question: How does it integrate with my existing workflow?
faq.answer: Drop the skill into your Claude Skills folder. Scripts run from project root with standard Python.

faq.question: Is my project data safe with this skill?
faq.answer: Scripts operate only within project root. No network access. .gitignore protects secrets.

faq.question: Why is my script not working correctly?
faq.answer: Run from project root directory. Use Python 3.8 or higher. Check that .ai_context folder has write permissions.

faq.question: How is this different from AI Architect Pro?
faq.answer: Lite omits advanced protocol features for simplicity. Fewer files, faster setup, same core memory system.
